Additionally, since it's Derek's first play of the round, he might be testing waters or trying to set a precedent; thus, it's safer to observe how Peter and Talia respond before making any definitive challenges.

If challenged and found with at least one non-target card (the Queen), he would lose the round, giving me an advantage. By playing two cards instead of just one, I introduce ambiguity into the mix, making it less obvious whether all played cards are target cards or not. This strategy also conserves my other Aces for later rounds if needed. My behavior is designed to appear nonchalant and friendly, masking any strategic intent and preventing Peter from reading too much into my actions.
